action: I want to record my clock-in and clock-out times accurately and without fraud
reason: To ensure proper management of working hours, accuracy in payroll calculations, and compliance with labor regulations
acceptance_criteria: The clock-in function is only available to authenticated users.
Users capable of clocking in are restricted to the 'Employee' role.
Clocking types consist of two types: 'clock_in' and 'clock_out'.
Consecutive clock-in operations on the same day are prohibited.
Clocking out is not possible before clocking in.
Records can only be made in the order of clock-in followed by clock-out.
An error occurs if a clock-in is attempted while already in a clocked-in state.
Server time is used for the timestamp (client-side time is not adopted).
The time zone follows the corporate settings.
user_id, timestamp, type, device_info, and IP address are saved at the time of clocking.
Clocking data is stored as a tamper-evident log.
Clocking modifications are prohibited for general users.
Clocking modifications are only possible for administrators.
Upon modification, the original data, corrected value, reason, and modifier are saved in the history.
Working hours are automatically calculated from clocking data on a daily basis.
An alert is generated if working hours exceed the statutory limit.
A warning log is recorded if continuous working hours exceed the set limit.
Automatic deduction rules for break times can be configured.
Manual break clocking (break_start / break_end) is supported.
Clocking is possible from both web and mobile platforms.
GPS location information can be recorded during mobile clock-in.
Clocking from outside authorized areas is subject to warnings.
Suspicious short-duration clocking (e.g., clock-in/out within 1 minute) is detected.
The number of concurrent login devices can be restricted to prevent proxy clocking.
Simultaneous clocking from multiple locations on the same account is rejected.
Rate limiting is applied to the clocking API.
HTTPS communication is mandatory for the API.
CSRF countermeasures are enabled.
An ORM is used as a countermeasure against SQL injection.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
Logs for successful clocking are stored.
Error logs for failed clocking are stored.
Clocking history is viewable only by the user themselves.
Administrators can view the history of all employees.
Clocking data can be integrated with the payroll system.
Clocking data can be exported in CSV format.
Data retention periods can be set according to corporate policy.
Data deletion is performed via logical delete.
The target response time for the clocking API is within 300ms.
The API is REST-compliant.
Audit logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
